intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to model an XML file source.

item.title: Create Local XML File Source Connection

description.b: Follow steps below to create a Teiid Flat File Connection profile

subitem.label: Launch New Flat File Source Connection Wizard

subitem.description:
1) Specify unique name and optional description and click Next >
2) Browse to select local file folder or enter file folder URL
3) Select desired options and click Finish

item.title: Create Local XML File Source Connection
item.description:
This following action creates a Teiid Local XML File Connection profile.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the connection profile wizard.
-- > 1) Specify unique name
-- > 2) Enter optional description
-- > 3) Click Next >
-- > 4) Browse to select local XML file
-- > 5) Click Finish
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created this connection profile.
============================================================

item.title: or ... Create Remote XML File Source Connection
item.description:
This following action creates a Teiid Remote XML File Connection profile.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the connection profile wizard.
-- > 1) Specify unique name
-- > 2) Enter optional description
-- > 3) Click Next >
-- > 4) Enter a valid URL to your remove XML file
-- > 5) Click Finish
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created this connection profile.
============================================================

item.title: Create Source From XML File Source
item.description:
This following action creates a relational model from importing table data via your Flat File connection profile.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to launch the Flat File import wizard.
-- > 1) Select an XML file import mode: Local File System or Remote URL and click Next >
-- > 2) Select XML Data File Source connection profile
-- > 3) Check the XML source file in the Available XML Data Files list
-- > 4) Browse to select target source model location
-- > 5) Enter valid unique source model name and click Next >
-- > 6) View the contents of your XML file in the top panel
-- > 7) Select a primary or root element and right-click Set As Root Path
-- > 8) Select elements and click Add selection as new column to customize the generated data transformation
-- > 9) Click Next > to enter view model name, location and view table name.
-- > 3) Click Finish
-- > You may skip this step if you have already imported this model.
============================================================

item.title: Test XML Table Data
item.description:
This following action allows you to preview data from your newly generated Flat File view table.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to preview data from your flat file.
-- > Click the browse "..." button to select the newly created view table
-- > Click OK to execute the query
-- > Results of the query will displayed in the SQL Results view
-- > You may skip this step.
============================================================

item.title: Create VDB
item.description:
This action will launch the New VDB wizard.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to create a new VDB.
-- > 1) Select "..." button to browse and select project or folder location.
-- > 2) Enter a unique name for your VDB
-- > 3) Enter an optional description for your VDB
-- > 4) Select the Add button to choose models to go in your VDB
-- > You may skip this step if you have already created your VDB.
============================================================

item.title: Test VDB
item.description:
This action will launch the Execute VDB wizard which will validate your VDB, insure you have a running Teiid server, deploy your VDB, open a JDBC connection to your VDB and open a SQL Scrapbook editor.
============================================================
-- > Press "Click to Perform" button below to test your VDB.
-- > 1) Select "..." button to browse and select a VDB.
-- > 2) Click OK to deploy VDB and open connection in Data Source Explorer
-- > 3) Follow instructions in open SQL Scrapbook Editor
-- > You may skip this step if you have already tested your VDB.
============================================================
